text: Our paper investigating domain impersonation (e.g., phishing) in TLS certificates has been (conditionally) accepted at CCS'19!
I gave a talk at IETF'105 for the ANRP award presentation and this is now publicly available. If you're interested in the current status and challenge of DNSSEC deployment please take a look!
We have two papers accepted at IMC'2019 about two cool PKI stuffs: RPKI (Resource PKI) and DNSSEC!
I am on the program committee for IMC 2019. Submit your cool work!

Our PKI team has received an NSF Large grant, 'CNS Core: Large: Collaborative Research: Towards an Evolvable Public Key Infrastructure' to develop an architecture to evolve the PKI! Thanks NSF and all my great collaborators, Christo, Alan, Dave, Bruce, and Bryan!

Our DNS research team will talk about two recent research projects at DNS-OARC 30 in Bangkok, Thailand!: Seeing the effects of DNS Flag Day in action (presented by Willem Toorop) and KSK Rollover Post-Analysis (presented by Duane Wessels)
I have received my first grant from NSF: Measuring and Improving the Management of Resource Public Key Infrastructure (RPKI), thanks NSF!

I wrote three guess blog posts: (1) Overcoming the limitations of OCSP, (2) Incorporating OCSP Must-Staple into certificates, and (3) Is the web ready for OCSP Must-Staple? for APNIC to discuss the current challanges of OCSP Must Staple in HTTPS.
Our paper 'Understanding the Role of Registrars in DNSSEC Deployment' has been selected as one of the 2019 awardees of the Applied Networking Research Prize

Our work 'Is the Web Ready for OCSP Must Staple?' has been presented at Measurement and Analysis for Protocols Research Group (MAPRG) at IETF-103 by Nick Sullivan who is the head of cryptography at Cloudflare
Our paper 'maTLS: How to Make TLS middlebox-aware?' is accepted at NDSS'19, big congrats to the leading author Hyunwoo Lee.
I gave a presentation at Great Lakes Security Day (GLSD) 2018 how PKI secures the Internet!
I will be teaching CSCI351 Data Communication and Networking in Fall 2018. Course details are available here

After wonderful years in Northeastern University, I have moved to RIT to start my career as an Assistant Professor. Thanks all of you, especially to my wonderful mentors, Alan Mislove and Dave Choffnes
Our paper 'Is the Web Ready for OCSP Must Staple?', is accepted at IMC'18!
I'll join at Rochester Institute of Technology (RIT) as an Assistant Professor at this Fall!
Our paper 'A First Look at Certification Authority Authorization (CAA)' is accepted at ACM CCR!
Our article summarizing DNSSEC papers now appears in USENIX ;login: magazine.
I wrote a guest blog post for APNIC about registrar's roles in DNSSEC deployment study
I'm on the job market for a faculty position! Research/teaching statements are available upon the request.
Our paper won the Distinguished Paper Award at USENIX Security'17!
Our paper 'Privacy Leakage in Event-based Social Networks: A Meetup Case Study' is accepted at CSCW'18!
Our paper 'Understanding the Role of Registrars in DNSSEC Deployment' is accepted at IMC'17!
